name: Core Exercises
description: Core stability and strength exercises - protect your back, build functional strength

exercises.name: Forearm Plank
exercises.description: Fundamental core exercise. Anti-extension work. Protects lower back. Scalable for all levels.
instructions: Place forearms on floor, elbows under shoulders
Extend legs back, balancing on toes
Create straight line from head to heels
Engage core by pulling belly button to spine
Don't let hips sag down or pike up
Keep neck neutral, looking at floor
Breathe steadily - don't hold your breath

modifications.easier: Drop to knees, or hold for shorter time (10-15 sec)
modifications.harder: Lift one arm or leg, add shoulder taps, extend duration

conditions.shoulder: May drop to knees to reduce load
conditions.lower_back: If hips sag, go to knees immediately
conditions.wrist: Can do on fists or use parallettes

exercises.name: Side Plank
exercises.description: Lateral core stability. Essential for runners. Protects hips and lower back from injury.
instructions: Lie on side, elbow directly under shoulder
Stack feet on top of each other
Lift hips so body forms straight line
Keep core tight and hips lifted
Top arm can reach to ceiling or rest on hip
Hold position while breathing steadily
Lower with control, switch sides

modifications.easier: Bottom knee on floor for support, shorter duration
modifications.harder: Lift top leg, add hip dips up and down, extend duration

conditions.shoulder: May need to modify or skip
conditions.hip: Focus on keeping hips stacked and lifted

exercises.name: Dead Bug
exercises.description: Core stability with controlled movement. Protects lower back. Great for neurodivergent users - simple pattern.
instructions: Lie on back, arms reaching to ceiling
Lift legs so knees bent at 90 degrees
Press lower back firmly into floor
Slowly lower right arm and left leg towards floor
Only go as low as you can while keeping back flat
Return to start, repeat opposite side
Move slowly - control is more important than speed

modifications.easier: Move only legs (keep arms still), or only arms (keep legs still)
modifications.harder: Slow to 5 seconds per rep, add ankle weights, straighten legs

conditions.lower_back: Perfect exercise for back issues - keep back glued to floor

exercises.name: Bird Dog
exercises.description: Anti-rotation core work. Builds stability and balance. Safe, effective. Part of McGill Big 3.
instructions: Start on hands and knees, wrists under shoulders
Knees under hips, back flat like tabletop
Brace core as if someone might push you
Slowly extend right arm forward and left leg back
Reach until arm and leg parallel to floor
Keep hips level - don't let them rotate
Hold briefly, return with control, switch sides

modifications.easier: Extend only arm OR only leg (not both)
modifications.harder: Add pause at extension, draw circles with limbs, add light weights

conditions.knee: Extra padding under knees, or do from elbow plank variation

exercises.videoSearch: bird dog exercise proper form mcgill

exercises.name: Pallof Press
exercises.description: Anti-rotation core exercise with band. Teaches core to resist rotation. Functional strength.
instructions: Attach resistance band to sturdy anchor at chest height
Stand sideways to anchor, hold band at chest
Step away to create tension in band
Feet shoulder-width, knees slightly bent
Press band straight out from chest
Band will try to rotate you - resist with core
Pull back to chest with control, repeat

modifications.easier: Lighter band, reduce distance from anchor, kneeling position
modifications.harder: Heavier band, further from anchor, standing on one leg

conditions.shoulder: Reduce band tension if shoulder uncomfortable

exercises.name: Russian Twist
exercises.description: Rotational core exercise. Builds obliques. Control the movement - quality over speed.
instructions: Sit on floor, knees bent, feet flat
Lean back slightly, keep back straight
Lift feet off floor if able (harder)
Hold hands together at chest
Rotate torso to right, touch floor beside hip
Rotate to left side, touch floor
Move with control - don't use momentum

modifications.easier: Keep feet on floor, hands at chest only (no weight)
modifications.harder: Hold medicine ball or dumbbell, straighten legs, extend arms

conditions.lower_back: Keep back straight (don't round), may need to skip if painful

exercises.name: Hollow Hold
exercises.description: Advanced core hold. Full-body tension. Builds incredible core strength. Challenging.
instructions: Lie on back, arms extended overhead
Press lower back into floor - this is critical
Lift shoulders and legs off floor
Body forms shallow dish or banana shape
Keep lower back pressed to floor throughout
Hold position, breathe steadily
If back lifts, bend knees or lift legs higher

modifications.easier: Bend knees, lift legs higher, bring arms to sides
modifications.harder: Lower legs closer to floor, rock back and forth, extend duration

conditions.lower_back: Must keep back pressed to floor - if it lifts, modify immediately

exercises.name: McGill Curl-Up
exercises.description: Dr. Stuart McGill's safer alternative to sit-ups. Protects spine. Part of McGill Big 3.
instructions: Lie on back, one knee bent, foot flat
Other leg straight on floor
Place hands under lower back for support
Lift head and shoulders slightly off floor
Only raise shoulders 1-2 inches - tiny movement
Hold for 10 seconds, lower with control
No neck strain - lead with chest not chin

modifications.easier: Lift shoulders even less, reduce hold time
modifications.harder: Extend hold time to 15 seconds, add more sets

conditions.lower_back: Perfect exercise - protects spine while building core
conditions.neck: If neck hurts, support head with towel or hands
